messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] OT: For Shannon (was: TS)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/8/03 4:24:20 PM, davenshan@mindspring.com writes:  Still very sad, but
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/8/03 4:24:20 PM, davenshan@... writes:

<< Thanks Sandra.  I changed it just now.  How’s it look? >>

Still very sad, but less likely to get "what does that mean?"
<<4/27/99-5/19/00 >>

And a longer dash might make it clearer (or a double hyphen).

Sandra

Shannon Buckley

at home 8/08/02

question...I just didn't even think of that because I had never seen it done
that way before.
Namaste,
Jen :o)
Jen :o)

Learning the natural way every day!

Shannon Buckley
Mom to Connor 3/15/97, Carsten born at home 4/27/99-5/19/00 and Quinn born at home 8/08/02

-----Original Message-----
From: SandraDodd@... [mailto:SandraDodd@...]
Sent: Monday, September 08, 2003 3:11 PM
To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] OT: For Shannon (was: TS)


In a message dated 9/8/03 3:29:08 PM, davenshan@... writes:

<< That is our second son who died when he was 12mos, 22days old. Maybe I
should put it another way. I had always wondered whether people would
understand what that meant. >>

I understood the note (figured it out), and I'm sorry you lost a baby.

It would be clearer if you used a long dash or a hyphen.

2-2-02—3-3-03 (control/shift on a Mac and I don't know what on others)
or
2-2-02 -- 3-3-03

Clearer still if you used slashes for dates
2/2/02—3/3/03.

Sandra (being technical, with apologies)

messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] OT: For Shannon (was: TS)
messages.msgSnippet: ... it and I can t figure it out.  I m sure it s something that is going to make me feel really dense, but it is just driving me nuts to not understand it.
messages.messageBody:
>Shannon,
>What does this part of your sig mean. I wonder about that every time I see
it and I can't figure it out. I'm sure it's >something that is going to
make me feel really dense, but it is just driving me nuts to not understand
it. Obviously I >know what "born at home" means...it's the / and the second
date that is throwing me off.

>Thanks,
>Jen :o)
>Mom to Beck (7) and Dane (5)
>Learning the natural way every day!


>Carsten born at home 4-27-99/5-19-00


That is our second son who died when he was 12mos, 22days old. Maybe I
should put it another way. I had always wondered whether people would
understand what that meant. But you are the first to ask.

Shannon Buckley
Mom to Connor 3-15-97, Carsten born at home 4-27-99/5-19-00 and Quinn born
at home 8-08-02

messages.subject: OT: For Shannon (was: TS)
messages.msgSnippet: Shannon, What does this part of your sig mean.  I wonder about that every time I see it and I can t figure it out.  I m sure it s something that is going to
messages.messageBody:
Shannon,
What does this part of your sig mean. I wonder about that every time I see it and I can't figure it out. I'm sure it's something that is going to make me feel really dense, but it is just driving me nuts to not understand it. Obviously I know what "born at home" means...it's the / and the second date that is throwing me off.

Thanks,
Jen :o)
Mom to Beck (7) and Dane (5)
Learning the natural way every day!
From: Shannon

Carsten born at home 4-27-99/5-19-00
